title: Ceiling
data:
The **ceiling** is a part of the dungeon where certain monsters or traps can be located. Some special levels (such as some [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") home levels, the [Plane of Air](/wiki/Plane_of_Air "Plane of Air"), and the [Plane of Water](/wiki/Plane_of_Water "Plane of Water")) do not have a ceiling. In those cases, NetHack substitutes different flavor text. [\[1\]](#cite_note-1).

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Monsters](#Monsters)

- [2 Traps](#Traps)

- [3 Items](#Items)

- [4 Other](#Other)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [5.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)

- [6 References](#References)

## Monsters

Only five monsters use the ceiling.

- p [rock piercer](/wiki/Rock_piercer "Rock piercer")
- p [iron piercer](/wiki/Iron_piercer "Iron piercer")
- p [glass piercer](/wiki/Glass_piercer "Glass piercer")
- t [lurker above](/wiki/Lurker_above "Lurker above")
- q [wumpus](/wiki/Wumpus "Wumpus")

Piercers and lurkers above hide on the ceiling until something stumbles onto their square. A hard helm will protect the player from a piercer's damage, but beware that pets will be instakilled by lurkers. Because wumpuses' feet stick to the ceiling, they can move over [water](/wiki/Moat "Moat") tiles without drowning.

Prior to NetHack 3.6.0, the game considered t [trappers](/wiki/Trapper "Trapper") to hide on the ceiling. This was [bug](/wiki/Bug "Bug") C342-51 in NetHack 3.4.3.

## Traps

When stepping on a [falling rock trap](/wiki/Falling_rock_trap "Falling rock trap"), a rock falls from a trapdoor in the ceiling.

## Items

A [drum of earthquake](/wiki/Drum_of_earthquake "Drum of earthquake"), when improvised, will unhide any monsters hidden on the ceiling.

Applying a [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip"), an [expensive camera](/wiki/Expensive_camera "Expensive camera"), or a [mirror](/wiki/Mirror "Mirror") up will produce a message about the ceiling.

Quaffing a cursed [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level") causes you to "**rise up, through the ceiling**" unless you are in [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban"), [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios"), the home level of the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest"), the top floor of [Vlad's tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_tower "Vlad's tower"), the top floor of the [Wizard's tower](/wiki/Wizard%27s_tower "Wizard's tower"), on dungeon level 1 without the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"), or in the [endgame](/wiki/Endgame "Endgame").

Quaffing a cursed [potion of levitation](/wiki/Potion_of_levitation "Potion of levitation") produces the message "**You bump your head on the ceiling**" and damages you.

Reading a [scroll of earth](/wiki/Scroll_of_earth "Scroll of earth") produces the message "**The ceiling rumbles around you!**" and creates several boulders.

Zapping a [wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging") or the [dig](/wiki/Spellbook_of_dig "Spellbook of dig") spell upwards will cause a [rock](/wiki/Rock "Rock") to fall on your head, but attempting to dig by any other means has no effect since you are unable to reach the ceiling.

## Other

There is a 1⁄4 chance that you may trigger a special type of trap door when [kicking](/wiki/Kick "Kick") a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne"). The message when this happens is, **"The floor opens up under you!"** followed by **"The hole in the ceiling above you closes up."** This is the only method of triggering this trap.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

No new traps are present in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), but rust traps will become fountains when untrapped. It is not clear if they are still considered ceiling traps.

### SporkHack

[SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack") introduces ceiling collapse traps, which drop several boulders onto the player.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), some levels (including most quest levels) are flagged as "outdoors". Scrolls of earth do not work on outdoor levels, and ceiling traps such as rust and falling rock traps won't generate. Throwing an object upwards will also not be shown as hitting a ceiling.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/engrave.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 213](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/engrave.c#L213)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Ceiling

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The ceiling is a part of the dungeon where certain monsters or traps can be located. Some special levels (such as some Quest home levels, the Plane of Air, and the Plane of Water) do not have a ceiling. In those cases, NetHack substitutes different flavor text. [1].

Contents

  • 1 Monsters
  • 2 Traps
  • 3 Items
  • 4 Other
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 SporkHack
    • 5.3 xNetHack
  • 6 References

Monsters

Only five monsters use the ceiling.

  • p rock piercer
  • p iron piercer
  • p glass piercer
  • t lurker above
  • q wumpus

Piercers and lurkers above hide on the ceiling until something stumbles onto their square. A hard helm will protect the player from a piercer's damage, but beware that pets will be instakilled by lurkers. Because wumpuses' feet stick to the ceiling, they can move over water tiles without drowning.

Prior to NetHack 3.6.0, the game considered t trappers to hide on the ceiling. This was bug C342-51 in NetHack 3.4.3.

Traps

When stepping on a falling rock trap, a rock falls from a trapdoor in the ceiling.

Items

A drum of earthquake, when improvised, will unhide any monsters hidden on the ceiling.

Applying a bullwhip, an expensive camera, or a mirror up will produce a message about the ceiling.

Quaffing a cursed potion of gain level causes you to "rise up, through the ceiling" unless you are in Sokoban, Fort Ludios, the home level of the Quest, the top floor of Vlad's tower, the top floor of the Wizard's tower, on dungeon level 1 without the Amulet of Yendor, or in the endgame.

Quaffing a cursed potion of levitation produces the message "You bump your head on the ceiling" and damages you.

Reading a scroll of earth produces the message "The ceiling rumbles around you!" and creates several boulders.

Zapping a wand of digging or the dig spell upwards will cause a rock to fall on your head, but attempting to dig by any other means has no effect since you are unable to reach the ceiling.

Other

There is a 1⁄4 chance that you may trigger a special type of trap door when kicking a throne. The message when this happens is, "The floor opens up under you!" followed by "The hole in the ceiling above you closes up." This is the only method of triggering this trap.

Variants

SLASH'EM

No new traps are present in SLASH'EM, but rust traps will become fountains when untrapped. It is not clear if they are still considered ceiling traps.

SporkHack

SporkHack introduces ceiling collapse traps, which drop several boulders onto the player.

xNetHack

In xNetHack, some levels (including most quest levels) are flagged as "outdoors". Scrolls of earth do not work on outdoor levels, and ceiling traps such as rust and falling rock traps won't generate. Throwing an object upwards will also not be shown as hitting a ceiling.

References

  1. ↑ src/engrave.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 213


Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Ceiling&oldid=169005"

rawPage:
The '''ceiling''' is a part of the dungeon where certain monsters or traps can be located. Some special levels (such as some [[Quest]] home levels, the [[Plane of Air]], and the [[Plane of Water]]) do not have a ceiling. In those cases, NetHack substitutes different flavor text. {{refsrc|src/engrave.c|213|nethack=3.6.7}}.

==Monsters==

Only five monsters use the ceiling.

*{{monsymlink|rock piercer}}
*{{monsymlink|iron piercer}}
*{{monsymlink|glass piercer}}
*{{monsymlink|lurker above}}
*{{monsymlink|wumpus}}

Piercers and lurkers above hide on the ceiling until something stumbles onto their square. A hard helm will protect the player from a piercer's damage, but beware that pets will be instakilled by lurkers. Because wumpuses' feet stick to the ceiling, they can move over [[moat|water]] tiles without drowning.

Prior to NetHack 3.6.0, the game considered {{monsymlink|trapper}}s to hide on the ceiling. This was [[bug]] C342-51 in NetHack 3.4.3.

==Traps==

When stepping on a [[falling rock trap]], a rock falls from a trapdoor in the ceiling.

==Items==

A [[drum of earthquake]], when improvised, will unhide any monsters hidden on the ceiling.

Applying a [[bullwhip]], an [[expensive camera]], or a [[mirror]] up will produce a message about the ceiling.

Quaffing a cursed [[potion of gain level]] causes you to "'''rise up, through the ceiling'''" unless you are in [[Sokoban]], [[Fort Ludios]], the home level of the [[Quest]], the top floor of [[Vlad's tower]], the top floor of the [[Wizard's tower]], on dungeon level 1 without the [[Amulet of Yendor]], or in the [[endgame]].

Quaffing a cursed [[potion of levitation]] produces the message "'''You bump your head on the ceiling'''" and damages you.

Reading a [[scroll of earth]] produces the message "'''The ceiling rumbles around you!'''" and creates several boulders.

Zapping a [[wand of digging]] or the {{+ of|dig}} spell upwards will cause a [[rock]] to fall on your head, but attempting to dig by any other means has no effect since you are unable to reach the ceiling.

==Other==

There is a {{frac|4}} chance that you may trigger a special type of trap door when [[kick|kicking]] a [[throne]]. The message when this happens is, '''"The floor opens up under you!"''' followed by '''"The hole in the ceiling above you closes up."''' This is the only method of triggering this trap.

==Variants==

===SLASH'EM===

No new traps are present in [[SLASH'EM]], but rust traps will become fountains when untrapped. It is not clear if they are still considered ceiling traps.

===SporkHack===

[[SporkHack]] introduces ceiling collapse traps, which drop several boulders onto the player.

===xNetHack===

In [[xNetHack]], some levels (including most quest levels) are flagged as "outdoors". Scrolls of earth do not work on outdoor levels, and ceiling traps such as rust and falling rock traps won't generate. Throwing an object upwards will also not be shown as hitting a ceiling.

==References==
<references/>
